bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister, by publishing a notice in the Gazette, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish an area of British Columbia as a log salvage district, and
abolish, or change the boundaries of, a log salvage district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may grant to a person who meets the prescribed qualifications a receiving station licence authorizing its holder to accept delivery of salvaged logs within a log salvage district.
A receiving station licence must contain the terms and conditions, consistent with this Act and the regulations, determined by the minister.
The holder of a receiving station licence must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: after the date specified in the licence, maintain facilities in the log salvage district for receiving, storing and sorting salvaged logs,
dispose of salvaged logs in the prescribed manner,
pay to the government the prescribed licence fees,
account for, hold, disburse and use the revenue the holder of the receiving station receives from the sale of salvaged logs in the prescribed manner, and

subject to the regulations, pay to holders of log salvage permits for salvaged logs delivered to the holder of the receiving station or a place specified by that holder, compensation in the prescribed amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a holder of a receiving station licence fails to comply with the licence, this Part or the regulations respecting log salvage, the minister may suspend the licence for a period of time and, whether or not the licence is under suspension, may cancel the licence.
Before the minister cancels a receiving station licence the minister must give the holder of the licence an opportunity to be heard.
A log receiving station licence granted under the former Act continues in force under this Act as a receiving station licence.
Subject to the regulations, a person must not salvage logs in a log salvage district without a log salvage permit.
The minister may grant a log salvage permit to a person who meets the prescribed qualifications.
A log salvage permit must contain the terms and conditions, consistent with this Act and the regulations, determined by the minister.
If the holder of a log salvage permit no longer meets the prescribed qualifications or fails to comply with the permit, this Part or the regulations respecting log salvage,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister may suspend the permit for a period of time, and
the minister, whether or not the permit is under suspension, may cancel the permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before the minister cancels a log salvage permit the minister must give the permit holder an opportunity to be heard.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposal and acquisition of salvaged logs
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not dispose of a log salvaged from a log salvage district and a person must not accept delivery of a log salvaged from a log salvage district, except as provided in the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If notified that logs have been lost in an area of coastal waters, the minister, in a notice published or broadcast, or both, in or near the area may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: order that the area described in the notice be closed to log salvaging for a period not exceeding 10 days for each order, and
amend the description of the area and, subject to the 10 day maximum, extend or shorten the period of the order.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: While an area is closed a person, other than the owner of a log or the owner's agent, must not salvage a log in the area described in the order.
